beer_brewer_name: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review_blob: on tap at rogue in portland. awesome awesome awesome. i was there to enoy fresh rogue and spent most of my time with this little guy... wrecked me though. 10%, woah. i dont know how i would ever handle HOTDs 29%er.
how do they manage to keep getting better? you know em, you know they arent going to make a bad beer, so go buy a bottle of this and drink it, thats all the review you need right? the word STONE?

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: as the guy below me said "I think that they have made the best beer out of beets that they could". i wish the packaging had been more deScriptive. i would have avoided this one. taste kind of like every other lager that maybe has been garnished with some vegetables.
chico, you people never stop blowing my mind. another great beer from the people who bring us the best widely available brews on the planet. we all know what IPAs taste like. this is a good one.

my first quad. aged just about 2 years depending on actual brew date. great color. not sure how i feed about this much cherry. dont know that i will get one again, but can accept that its a good brew if you like this sort of thing.
eh, it was free. two 6 packs. ill finish them but i wont make any effort to get any more
brilliant. not quite the hopslam but still a wonderful beer. i will continue to drink it. too bad i live in stupid oklahoma and cant buy it til i get home for the holidays
as far as barleywine goes, ill have this again. 9 bucks was quite the price for it though... from a retailer. maybe 6 would be better.
one of the reasons for the slightly lower score is due to the fact this felt a bit more like a stout our porter than a strong ale. call me crazy, but i just dont agree on the classification.

i think its funny that anyone actually could pour this without a huge head. i tried. even wicked slow on a super slant, HUGE head. i dont be buying it again. after a coupe of them in a pint glass i just drank from the bottle, even then, every kick back reared a HUGE head. super cloudy. not so much on the flavour.
i want to keep this on my list so im just gonna type some stuff in so i can rate it and then maybe re rate it later. i remember it being decent.

wow. i wish they made this year round and i wish that it was what was in their green labal pale ale.just popped into my vision while standing in line the other day, i bought two. one to drink, one to age. man this was good stuff.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada Harvest Fresh Hop IPA - Southern Hemisphere

review_blob: i made my own 6 pack at a local beer store, this is the only one of all of them that i will buy again. pleasently surprised after 5 miserable beers. give it a try people.
i guess if this wasnt right next to Rouge Hazelnut Brown at the store, i mgiht buy it again. too bad that it is, cus i wont.

im curious as to how old mine is seeing as how its retired and i just bought it this week. ive been trying anything i can get my hands on out here in my new home of oklahoma and i found this. im not going to find it anymore.

as far as i can expect myself to like an english pale, this wasnt bad. i bought if cus its from montana, too bad brewers sell. seems as if its not made there anymore and my guess is that its not as good as it used to be.
another disappointing bottle of beer that is still one of the best i can get in tulsa. i need something better. thank god for Great Divide. thats about all you can get here.
i recently moved to oklahoma, this is one of the best beers i can find in the beer stores. i cry myself to sleep at night. someone change some laws please, someone get me dogfish head!!
maybe i got a bad batch. mine tasted like dirt. i bought a six pack and two other people wouldnt even finish their drink. not good at all.
purchased by friends as a gift. as a joke. with a name like that they just kinda thought it would be funny. it was. and good too.
beautiful. great head. lots of carbonation.settled quite a bit. really good. id love to have it again soon.

this was a gift from some friends who got it cus it was in a box and aged. they know i like beer. i think they imagined it to be a lame beer in fancy packaging. it was a good beer. i liked it. wish i had some more.
i tell girls to get this when im ordering something a bit more brutal. its nice. refreshing. if i were to really love wheats, id like this one a lot.
hhhhhhhhhhhhhh hhhhhh hhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh hhhhhhh hhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh hhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh hhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh hhhhhhhhhhh hhhhhhhhhh hhhhhhhhhhh hhhhhhhhhhhhhhh
having never heard of southern tier, i just picked up the bottle cus it said imperial ipa. god i am happy that i did. go buy this drink. now.

i was pleasantly surprised. i had just finished another of boulders products that i didnt like and this one made up for it quite a bit.Earlier Rating: 12/12/2007 Total Score: 2.3im not so sure that this is the beer i want to review, cus there are two without pictures and i cant remember the brewer.... didnt care for it
beer_name: Boulder Beer Hazed Hoppy Session Ale

review_blob: given to me, didnt finish it, didnt drink another, probably wont buy another but if there is nothing else at the bar i like, id get it, i think.
yet another good go at making a beer by the people from chico. thats all i want to say. for real. thats it. i dont want to type anymore.

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: so i finally got to have some of this while up in northampton ma. cant ever find it at home. very very awesome. im was super pleased and would love to be able to get this more in my own area of dwelling
kinda tasted like dirt. i was not happy with it and didnt really care to finish it. im not so sure why people are giving it a 3 or better.
i pretty much thought it was bad. my buddy pretty much thought it was bad. get me out of wisconsin
not gonna say i liked it too much, a friend brought it over. i drank it. it was okay. its not something id buy but i finished it. course, i dont like ginger.
i was pleasently surprised. someone on the east coast other than dogfish makig a fairly respectable ipa. i was happy with it. ill still grab something else over this but im still proud of home.

best fruit beer i think ive ever had. ill have it again. ill tell others to drink it. didnt think id like it, so i only got one bottle, im gonna go back and get more. its a nice change from a typical ipa.
sorry dogfish, you lost me on this one. id stick with a sierra nevada before buying this again, tis not horrible, its actually pretty good. its just not THAT good. nothing special. just a beer.
well, im not so big into esb but stoudts has never failed me. i like it okay. id rather buy some of their other beers but i would drink this again.
once again, wish i had bothered to check this website before buying. thank god it was only one. i didnt like it. i wont buy it again.
thank god i only bought one bottle. i didnt like it at all. i didnt even finish it. i drank it after a stoudts double ipa. maybe that was a bad idea.

review_blob: overall, i just think that people need to stop making english style beers. this was fine i guess, but american pale ales are just so much better.

god why cant i get this beer here at home without it being a pain? what did i do to deserve only a taste?

two bottles at a local bar. loved every second and cent.
wow, horrible. like, really horrible. could be the worst "india" pale ale ever. thats what i get for going to canada.
i really should have had more of their beer. this was a good one. nothing to write home about but i did walk out with a growler. i drank it into oblivion.
good stuff. on tap at a jock and jills in atlanta. bartender recommended it. it was good. i kept drinking it. he gave me a frozen mug though, i hate that.
good. very good. thats all you need to know. who cares what colour, who cares what smell, it tastes fantastic and thats all that really matters right?
not horrible. whatever. better than the steak. if i go back, ill have that again. it was pretty.
